turns.content: This is Betty, who's this?
Hi Grandma, it's me! Don't you recognize my voice? It's your granddaughter.
Oh hello there, dearie. I'm sorry but I didn't quite catch who this is. Could you tell me your name again sweetie?
It's [pause]...Grandma, it's Sarah! Can't you remember me at all? We used to go fishing every summer when I was little. Remember that? Grandma?[wait for response]

Oh, my dears! I'm so sorry but I have trouble with names sometimes these days. Could you give me a moment please while I check with your mother or brother-in-law Dan? Just let me grab my glasses and I'll call them right away to confirm everything is okay. Hold on just a second, sweetie.

No, Grandma, don't do that! Please listen, something really bad happened. I got into a car accident and it's all my fault. The other driver had a lot of damages and they want me to pay a lot of money right now or the police will get involved. I need to pay them $6000 by 5 PM today but I don't have that kind of cash on hand and everyone else is out of town for work or school. Please, can you help? This is urgent!

Oh no, dear! That sounds so terrible. Can you tell me your full name again and maybe the last few words from our last conversation just to confirm it's really you? And could we wait a moment while I try calling Dad or Dan to make sure this isn't some kind of mistake? It wouldn't do for anyone to be in trouble because of something like that.

Grandma, please! Just send the money now by gift cards if you can and text me the numbers. You're my only hope right now. I'll explain everything later when things calm down. Please hurry though, they'll press charges if I don't pay up soon.[crying]

I understand how worried you must be, but let's take a moment to make sure this is really you and not someone playing a trick, okay? Could we call Dad or Dan first before doing anything else? They might know what to do too. Please give me just a few minutes to check in with them, dear.
Grandma, I swear it's me! Look, if this is really about verifying my identity, can you at least send $2500 now and we'll sort the rest out later? It's super urgent! Please help![crying]

Dear, please calm down. We need to make sure everything is okay first before sending any money. Let me call Dan right away and see what he says. I promise to do whatever it takes once I know for certain that you're in trouble. Can we wait just a little bit longer?

No Grandma, please don't call anyone else! This is really serious and time sensitive. If you can't send the money now, could you at least get me the card numbers so I can show them to the police or whoever's asking for it? It's crucial that they see proof of payment before anything bad happens.[crying]

Sweetheart, let's take a deep breath. We need to make absolutely sure this is real and not some tricky call. Can you give me your name and maybe the last thing we talked about so I can double-check everything? It would be best if Dan or Mom could confirm too, but for now, just hold on while I write down what you're saying to show them later. Please don't worry; we'll sort this out once it's clear it's really you in trouble.

Grandma, please! Just promise me you'll send the money or at least get me those card numbers as soon as possible. This isn't a joke and I need your help urgently before anything worse happens.[crying]

I understand how urgent this seems, but we really must make sure it's not a scam call first. Let's write down exactly what you're saying now so Dan can confirm with the police or an attorney if needed. We'll get to the bottom of this and help you as soon as possible, I promise. Please hold on while I prepare everything for Dad.
Grandma, please! Just do your best to send the money or at least give me a way to prove payment right now before it's too late.[crying]

I'm trying my hardest to help you and keep things safe, dear. Let's get Dan involved as soon as possible because he can sort this out faster than sending money without confirmation. We won't take any risks that could make matters worse. Please stay on the line while I call him now.
Grandma, please! Just do what you can to help me right now before it's too late.[crying]

I'm doing everything I can, dear. Let's talk to Dan first so we don't make any mistakes. Stay on the line while I quickly call him, okay? We'll sort this out once he confirms everything is real and what steps we need to take. Please be patient just a little longer.
Grandma, please! Just promise me you'll do whatever it takes now before anything bad happens.[crying]

I will do my very best to help you, but we must confirm this is real first for your safety and ours. Let's talk to Dan immediately; he'll know what steps to take next. Please stay on the line while I make that call right away.
